content.narrative: Aseguradora enfrenta múltiples riesgos cyber. Para ransomware (ALE $2M): MITIGATE con EDR + backups ($500K inversión). Para regulatory fines por data breach: TRANSFER con cyber insurance ($200K premium, $50M coverage). Para legacy system (costo modernizar $10M vs riesgo $100K/año): ACCEPT riesgo documentado. Para obsolete system crítico con riesgo $5M: AVOID retirando sistema.

title: Opciones de Tratamiento de Riesgo - NIST SP 800-39

content.intro: 4 estrategias principales para tratar riesgos identificados.

tabs.label: Accept
tabs.title: Aceptar el Riesgo
tabs.text: NO hacer nada, asumir riesgo conscientemente. Usar cuando: costo de mitigar > impacto del riesgo, o riesgo ya dentro de risk appetite. Requiere aprobación formal de management. Documentar justificación. Re-evaluar periódicamente.

tabs.label: Avoid
tabs.title: Evitar el Riesgo
tabs.text: Eliminar actividad que causa riesgo. Ej: retirar sistema vulnerable, cancelar proyecto, no ofrecer servicio. Usar cuando: riesgo demasiado alto y no mitigable cost-effectively. Impacto en negocio debe considerarse.

tabs.label: Mitigate
tabs.title: Mitigar/Reducir el Riesgo
tabs.text: Implementar controles para reducir likelihood o impact. Más común. Ej: firewalls, encryption, training, backups. Objetivo: reducir inherent risk a residual risk aceptable. Costo de control < expected loss.

tabs.label: Transfer
tabs.title: Transferir el Riesgo
tabs.text: Compartir riesgo con tercero. Ej: cyber insurance, outsourcing, contractual agreements. NO elimina riesgo totalmente. Proveedor puede fallar. Útil para riesgos financieros altos pero baja likelihood.

content.overview: Póliza que cubre pérdidas financieras por cyber incidents.

coverage_types.covers: Pérdidas directas: business interruption, data recovery, ransom payments, forensics, legal fees, notification costs
Liability: demandas de clientes, regulatory fines, PCI penalties

considerations: Premium cost: $50K - $500K+ dependiendo de revenue, industry, security posture
Exclusions: acts of war, prior known vulnerabilities, gross negligence
Requirements: security questionnaire, might require MFA, EDR, backups
Claims process: puede tardar meses, no cubre todo
content.when_to_use: Riesgos con high financial impact pero acceptable likelihood. Complementa controles técnicos, NO los reemplaza.
content.limitation: Insurance paga $, no restaura reputation, no previene incident. Treat como backstop, no primary defense.

content.concept: Ongoing awareness del estado de security para informar risk decisions dinámicamente.
content.why_continuous: Riesgos cambian: nuevas vulnerabilities (CVEs), threat landscape evoluciona, configs drift, business changes. Annual assessment es insuficiente.

components.tools: SIEM, vulnerability scanners, config management (Puppet, Chef), cloud security posture (CSPM)

components.examples: % systems patched, mean time to patch, # critical vulns, control compliance %

components.data: # incidents, MTTD, MTTR, trends over time
components.use: Validate if controls working, adjust risk ratings

components.process: Security impact analysis for all changes. Does change introduce new risk? Increase residual risk?
components.integration: ITIL change process with security review

conmon_benefits: Real-time risk awareness vs annual snapshot

title: Supply Chain Risk Management - NIST SP 800-161

content.threat: Compromise de vendor/supplier afecta tu organización. Ej: SolarWinds, Target (HVAC vendor), Kaseya.
scm_risks: Malicious code en software de vendor
Lack of security in vendor practices
Vendor data breach exposes tu data

controls.activities: Security questionnaires, SOC 2 reports, penetration test results, certifications (ISO 27001)

controls.clauses: SLAs for security, breach notification (24h), right to audit, indemnification, data handling requirements

controls.implementation: Separate network segment, VPN with MFA, time-limited access, no persistent credentials, monitor vendor activity

controls.activities: Log vendor access, alert on anomalies, periodic review of vendor permissions

content.target_lesson: Target: vendor (Fazio) compromised. Attackers pivoted from vendor network to payment systems. Falta de network segmentation = supply chain risk became enterprise risk.

scenarios.scenario: Legacy manufacturing system (20 años), no patches disponibles, múltiples critical CVEs. Costo reemplazar $5M. Riesgo ALE $200K.

analysis.accept: $200K/year < $5M upfront. Pero riesgo aumenta con tiempo. No sostenible long-term.
analysis.avoid: Retirar sistema detiene producción. Business no acepta.
analysis.mitigate: Air-gap system, network segmentation, strict access control, monitoring intensivo. Costo $500K.
analysis.transfer: Cyber insurance cubre parte pero no todo. Insurance no previene incident.

scenarios.recommended: MITIGATE (air-gap + segmentation) SHORT-TERM + plan para REPLACE system en 3 años (budget $5M). Accept residual risk con aprobación de Board.

scenarios.scenario: GDPR compliance gap. Falta de consent management. Multa potencial €20M. Costo implementar $1M.
scenarios.recommended: MITIGATE. Implementar consent management. Regulatory compliance no es opcional. Cost < potential fine.

scenarios.scenario: Risk de DDoS contra website. ALE $100K. DDoS mitigation service (Cloudflare) $50K/year.
scenarios.recommended: TRANSFER/MITIGATE híbrido. Use DDoS mitigation service (transfers burden de mitigation). Costo < ALE, ROI positivo.

content.question: Risk ALE $2M. Control cuesta $500K implementar + $100K/year. Reduce risk 60%. ¿Qué hacer?

options.text: Implement - New ALE $800K (60% reduction). Savings $1.2M/year - $100K = $1.1M/year benefit. ROI positivo.
options.feedback: Correcto. $2M × 0.4 (40% remaining) = $800K new ALE. Savings $1.2M - $100K ongoing = $1.1M/year. Payback $500K / $1.1M = 5.5 months. Excellent ROI.
Posible pero control es más cost-effective con este ROI. Insurance es complemento, no replacement.
